title: Authentication generator templates in Rails 8 do not use a `.tt` suffix
body:
### Steps to reproduce

See the template generator files in this folder in railties: `railties/lib/rails/generators/rails/authentication/`.

The problem is that all of the template files underneath `templates/` do not use a `.tt` suffix, where all other generator templates do. I'm unsure on whether this is intentional or not, but it has the effect that the files inside this folder (which are bundled with the Rails gem) are treated as Ruby files by editors. This means the code inside them will show up as library code, and can affect editor actions. For example, in RubyMine "Go to Declaration" now offers this code as a valid target when trying to navigate to a "User" model. I have not tested this with VSCode and language servers, but I suspect it affects them too.

I am unsure on the history of the `.tt` extension, but I would say it is good practice as it helps prevent any of this code from being accidentally loaded. I think it is worth having this extension even if the authentication generator currently works without it.

### Expected behavior

Template files should have a unique suffix that ensures they are not accidentally recognised as Ruby code.

### Actual behavior

The current authentication template files are picked up by various editor actions as they are considered Ruby code that is part of the project.

### System configuration
**Rails version**: 8.0.0.beta1

**Ruby version**: 3.3.5
